alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Logan; Wallace; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 10:15PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Wichita, Wallace, western Logan and Greeley Counties through 1000 PM MDT/1100 PM CDT/... At 915 PM MDT/1015 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northwest of Sharon Springs to 9 miles north of Tribune to 15 miles southeast of Horace. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of western Wichita, Wallace, western Logan and Greeley Counties, including the following locations... Lydia and Selkirk. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
